summary: This bill, the "Connecting And Building Lines for Expedited Expansion Act" (CABLE Expansion Act), amends the Communications Act of 1934 regarding cable franchise authority. It aims to streamline the process for cable operators to place, construct, or modify facilities. It specifies timeframes for franchising authorities to approve or deny requests (90 days for facilities on eligible support infrastructure, 150 days otherwise) and mandates written decisions backed by evidence. The bill also defines "eligible support infrastructure" and "covered facility."
